body: Thanks! It would be great if you could implement "staggered" scanning, e.g. click on "rescan all" - starts scan folder A, waits until this folder status != scanning any more, then continues folder B, etc.
Is there a limit of somekind on how often StateChanged event can be emitted? I wrote rescaning folders sequentially, but if it ends fast then the statuses aren't able to change appropriately in time.
I think the way this should be done is by adding a /rest/rescanAll call in Go land (probably with an optional sequential=true flag) this way you don't need any magic in the JS.
Or just have a special case of current /rest/rescan to rescan everything if no folder is provided.

issue.title: Button to rescan all folders, fixes #1151

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Button to rescan all folders, fixes #1151 

I am not sure about it, because I think that if I click on rescan button to often, or for example rescan one folder and than rescan all, statuses sometimes don't show what I would like them to show. If somebody could take a look at it that would be awesome. (from the user point of view it looks as if some of the folders were scanning to shortly to show the change in the status or they were not scanned at all)

Apart from that little thing it is ok.
